Material used.Material Name: Wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: The αS solutions were prepared as described previously. Briefly, wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T) were purchased from Recombinant Peptide Technologies and were stored at - 80 °C. αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Conclusion: Accelerated fαS formation compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated fαS formation, especially the elongation process
Readout description.Result Description: E46K αS peptide accelerated fαS formation compared with the WT αS peptide. E46K, A53T and A30P/A53T αS peptides increased the growth rate meaning elongation phase compared with the WT αS peptide

Readout description.Conclusion: Decelerated fαS formation compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Decelerated fαS formation, especially the elongation process
Readout description.Result Description: A30P αS peptide decelerated fibril formation compared with WT αS peptide. The A30P peptide decreased the growth rate compared with the WT αS peptide

Readout description.Conclusion: Accelerated fαS formation compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated fαS formation, especially the elongation process
Readout description.Result Description: A53T αS peptide accelerated fαS formation compared with the WT αS peptide. E46K, A53T and A30P/A53T αS peptides increased the growth rate meaning elongation phase compared with the WT αS peptide

Readout description.Conclusion: Accelerated fαS formation compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated fαS formation, especially the elongation process
Readout description.Result Description: A30P/A53T αS peptide accelerated fαS formation compared with the WT αS peptide. E46K, A53T and A30P/A53T αS peptides increased the growth rate meaning elongation phase compared with the WT αS peptide

Biological replicates.Description: Each figure comprises data obtained with 3 independent experiments.

Material used.Material Name: Wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: The αS solutions were prepared as described previously. Briefly, wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T) were purchased from Recombinant Peptide Technologies and were stored at - 80 °C. αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Conclusion: Accelerated secondary structure change compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated SC → α/β → β secondary structure transitions
Readout description.Result Description: E46K αS displayed substantially accelerated kinetic, with t1/2 ≈ 0.6 d. Conformational change in E46K αS was complete by day 2

Readout description.Conclusion: Decelerated secondary structure change compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Decelerated SC → α/β → β secondary structure transitions
Readout description.Result Description: A30P αS displayed substantial secondary structure changes during days 1 - 6, with t1/2 ≈ 1.6 d

Readout description.Conclusion: Slightly accelerated secondary structure change compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated SC → α/β → β secondary structure transitions
Readout description.Result Description: A53T αS peptides displayed slightly accelerated kinetics, with t1/2 ≈ 1.1 d. Conformational changes in the A53T αS peptides were complete by day 5

Readout description.Conclusion: Slightly accelerated secondary structure change compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Accelerated SC → α/β → β secondary structure transitions
Readout description.Result Description: A30P/A53T αS peptides displayed slightly accelerated kinetics, with t1/2 ≈ 1.1 d. Conformational changes in the A30P/A53T αS peptides were complete by day 5

Biological replicates.Description: The spectra presented at each time are representative of those obtained during each of 3 independent experiments.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Photo - induced cross - linking of unmodified proteins (PICUP) and sodium dodecyl sulfate - polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS - PAGE)

Material used.Material Name: Wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: The αS solutions were prepared as described previously. Briefly, wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T) were purchased from Recombinant Peptide Technologies and were stored at - 80 °C. αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (frequency distribution of monomers and oligomers)

Readout description.Conclusion: Higher order oligomers compared to WT
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Increased propensity to form relatively large oligomers
Readout description.Result Description: When the oligomers were stabilized by cross - linking, E46K αS was composed of higher order species, including pentamers and hexamers. The oligomer/monomer ratio of E46K αS was 1.98 ± 0.07

Readout description.Conclusion: Lower order oligomers compared to WT
Readout description.Result Description: The oligomers of A30P αS were composed of monomers to trimers. The oligomer/monomer ratio of A30P αS was 0.73 ± 0.02
The oligomers of A53T αS showed a distribution similar to that of WT αS. The oligomer/monomer ratio of A53T αS was 1.63 ± 0.12
The oligomers of A30P/A53T αS peptides showed a distribution similar to that of WT αS. The oligomer/monomer ratio of A30P/A53T αS was 1.68 ± 0.12

Biological replicates.Description: The gel is representative of three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Non - cross - linked samples were used as controls in each experiment.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometry was then performed using a luminescent image analyzer (LAS 4000 mini, Fujifilm, Tokyo) and image analysis software (Multi gauge version 3.2, Fujifilm)

Material used.Material Name: Wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: The αS solutions were prepared as described previously. Briefly, wild - type αS (WT), E46K mutant αS (E46K), A30P mutant αS (A30P), A53T mutant αS (A53T), and A30P/A53T mutant αS (A30P/A53T) were purchased from Recombinant Peptide Technologies and were stored at - 80 °C. αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.
